intro: Hamulia flava, commonly known as the yellow hamula, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and palmate leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in coastal areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
